intro: Echinospermum szovitsianum, commonly known as the Hungarian echinopsis, is a flowering plant native to Hungary and parts of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Echinospermum szovitsianum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens with full sun.
